summary: In this context, butane is discussed as a liquefied petroleum gas with various applications, including use in lighter fluid and as a propellant. The text highlights the toxic effects of butane, particularly when inhaled, leading to asphyxiation and potential fatal outcomes. The mention of butane in different forms (n-butane, isobutane) emphasizes its relevance in toxicological cases, particularly in instances of abuse and accidental inhalation.
